FuncDef: This command initiates an ETH-CFM test. The implementation supports a single ETH-TST PDU to check unidirectional reachability, launched from a source MEP and terminated on the remote MEP with no response PDU toward the source.
CLIs: eth-test { <mac-address> | remote-mepid <mep-id> } mep <mep-id> domain <md-index> association <ma-index> [ priority <priority> ] [ data-length <data-length> ]

ParaDef.Info: Specifies a unicast destination MAC address in the format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx or xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx.

Specifies the remote MEP ID of the peer within the association. The domain and association information are derived from the source mep for the session. The Layer 2 IEEE MAC address is resolved from previously-learned remote MAC addressing, derived from the reception and processing of the ETH-CC PDU. The local MEP must be administratively enabled. Values-1 to 8191.
Specifies the local MEP ID. Values-1 to 8191.
Specifies the MD index. Values-1 to 4294967295.
Specifies the MA index. Values-1 to 4294967295.
Specifies the priority of the frame. The priority can be manipulated by QoS policies. Values-0 to 7. ParamDefault: Default- 7
Specifies the size of the padding to be added to the frame. Values-64 to 1500. ParamDefault: Default- 0
